directions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Butter 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish. Layer 1/3 of potatoes in prepared dish, overlapping slightly. Sprinkle with 1/3 of salt and 1/3 of pepper. Sprinkle with 1/3 of tarragon, then with 1/3 of cheese. Repeat layering twice more with remaining potatoes, salt, pepper, tarragon, and cheese.

Whisk cream and wine in medium bowl to blend. Pour over potatoes. Bake uncovered until potatoes are tender when pierced with knife and top is golden, about 1 hour. Let gratin stand 5 minutes before serving.
ingredients: 3 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled, cut into 1/8-inch-thick rounds
1 1/2 cups (packed) grated sharp white cheddar cheese (about 6 ounces)
title: Gratin of Potatoes with White Cheddar and Tarragon
